alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 4:27PM MDT until August 15 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Kane County in southern Utah... * Until 1030 PM MDT Monday. * At 427 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in The Paria River and Wahweap Creek Drainage areas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. For the Paria...the flood wave is expected to move downstream from its upper headwaters south to the Utah/Arizona border. For Wahweap... The flood wave is expected to move from its upper headwaters to its terminus in Lake Powell near Bullfrog. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Big Water. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
